data.title: Crazy Busy and well-deserved
data.text: Had breakfast here with a local on a super busy Sunday morning.  The chicken fried stead was not the best I have had, since it was frozen and mass produced, but it was good with excellent country gravy.  The eggs were done perfectly along with the hash browns, and the coffee refills were easy to get.  Others had the club sandwich and pancakes and all were deemed impressive and most satisfying.  A "local hangout" and clearly I now know why.

data.title: Good food and a lot of it
data.text: Whenever my parents in law come to town, they choose Rodeo Coffee Shop for breakfast because the food is good, the portions are large, and the service is quick. This place keeps the Clovis home town feel by keeping the same servers you know and remaining small. Because they are in a small space, expect a wait if you go during traditional breakfast hours.

data.title: Best breakfast in Clovis.
data.text: Rodeo has been in business many years and various owners. 2 out of every 100 visits the food might not be up to their standards but, the 98. Grits, biscuits, fried country potatoes, pancakes all man size portions. Really good food at good prices. Be ready to relax and wait for your order, it does take time.

data.title: Tops in Clovis
data.text:
Of the independent  breakfast places in Clovis, Sandys, BJ's, Jus Jo's, B&S, this on is the best. 
It's very small so arrive earlier than you think. 
Large omelette switch real filling inside, real biscuits and gravy, great burgers, and heavenly pies !
Old, old school place with old school, quality food !

data.title: YUM!
data.text: What a great place for breakfast! The service is fun and friendly and the food is hot and delicious! We love the ham, eggs, and French toast! Can't beat the prices and there's a short wait to receive your order!

data.title: Ample, tasty servings & attentive staff
data.text: Simple food done right. Eggs over easy, bacon (4 strips!), country potatoes (with onions/peppers added at our request, one order of English muffins, one order of biscuits and gravy. Our coffee cups were never empty, even brewed a pot of decaf for my friend. We jawboned for an hour and left well fed. We started at 9 a.m. on a weekday, and it was still busy when we left after 10. With a nice tip, $30. We will be back. Only complaint: the built-in booths have tables that don't fit folks with larger waist sizes, and the stand-alone tables are few. Get here early. You won't be disappointed. Truly a Clovis bright star!

data.title: Breakfast local eatery
data.text: Nice old town Clovis cowboy coffee shop for breakfast. The portions are generous and the price fair. However, the service was not that great.The waitress was a bit grumpy and forgot coffee refills and water often. Aside of that and the wait to be seated the food and atmosphere were enjoyable.

data.title: Quaint breakfast cafe in Old Town
data.text: This place has lots of charm with a cowboy rodeo theme! Good food and good service. Coffee was excellent. They are known for their french toast that is dipped in pancake batter and then cooked! Nice way to start a morning of shopping in Old Town Clovis.

data.title: Good Ol' where the locals go
data.text: Good serving however, you do need to expect to be early as it is first come first serve.  I also find it simply an americana Rodeo type of place to experience Clovis.

data.title: Family Breakfast & Lunch
data.text: Best breakfast in Clovis! Try the chili verde or enchilada omelettes. Biscuits and gravy are a must and if you're in for lunch try their club sandwich!

data.title: Best Breakfast in Clovis!
data.text: All food is fresh and cooked to order! Best gravy you'll ever taste! May take a few minnutes to get there, but well worth the wait! Omlets are the best around!

data.title: what a breakfast
data.text: Oh if you like breakfast this is the place.  B set in Clovis.  Menu is big and it is all terrific.  Great service.  Sometimes a wait but worth it.

data.title: A local Favorite!
data.text: get there early or wait in line...fresh and yummy breakfast! worth your time and money. clean and usually fast service. enjoy!

data.title: Great Food. Slow service.
data.text: If you leave here hungry it's your fault. Outstanding hash browns and home fries. The sausage patties are homemade and delicious. Very slow service but worth the wait.

data.title: Great breakfast in downtown Clovis
data.text: I was turned on to this place by a friend who lived in Clovis. We always have to get there early or late because it is a very popular place. Eggs poached perfect, big tasty biscuits, and the best breakfast potatoes I have ever had! Service is good and they have a waitress or two that have been there forever. What's not to like?

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: This was my first visit to the rodeo cafe. My friend recommended the enchilada omelet. It was incredibly good and huge. The home fries were delicious as well as the sourdough toast. I can't wait for my next trip out to Clovis so I can have another enchilada omelet!

data.title: Used to be great
data.text: Used to go here for breakfast all the time, but the last few times it's just gone downhill. The food is VERY greasy. Service so so. You can tell that this has happened as the place used to hVe a line out the door in the mornings but not any longer.  For a place with the same country atmosphere but great food value and service we pick Sandys down the street on Clovis Ave. Sorry Rodeo, you're just past your prime. :-(
